faq.headline: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subheadline: Everything you need to know about inShare

questions.question: What is inShare?
questions.answer: inShare is a secure document sharing and analytics platform with branding, follow-ups, AI insights, and CRM featuresâ€”designed for businesses that want more control than Google Drive or Dropbox offer.

questions.question: How is inShare different from Google Drive or Dropbox?
questions.answer: Unlike traditional storage tools, inShare provides view tracking, link analytics, branding with your domain, automatic follow-ups, and web intelligence without scriptsâ€”features that Drive/Dropbox don't offer.

questions.question: Does inShare show who viewed my document?
questions.answer: Yes. You can see view count, unique visitors, IP and location, device and browser, and precise view timestamps for each document.

questions.question: Can I add my own domain?
questions.answer: Yes. You can share documents from your own domain, such as files.yourbrand.com, so links feel professional and on-brand.

questions.question: Is my data secure?
questions.answer: Absolutely. All documents are encrypted using industry-standard security. You can protect access with passwords, expiry dates, or view limits.

questions.question: Can I automate follow-ups?
questions.answer: Yes. You can set automated reminders and WhatsApp/Gmail triggers based on events like 'client viewed the document', 'no response after X days', or lead stage changes.

questions.question: Who is inShare built for?
questions.answer: inShare is perfect for agencies, real estate, consultants, coaches, freelancers, SMBs, and corporate sales teamsâ€”anyone who sends documents to close deals.

questions.question: Do you offer a custom plan?
questions.answer: Yes. If your business needs custom storage, advanced branding, or specific team features, we can build a custom plan around your requirements.

questions.question: Do I need to install any scripts?
questions.answer: No. Our AI-powered web insights work without any external scripts or trackers, so you stay privacy-friendly and compliant.

questions.question: Can I track downloads?
questions.answer: Yes. You can enable or disable downloads for each file and track every download event in your analytics.
